channel.title: ".." bug
channel.description:
hi, i made my model but when i insert it into my server and i drop the item, when i right click i get option .. item. how do i remove that? i have the option to pick it up under but i dont know what the .. does, and how to remove it. thnks
EDIT: heres a pic of the prblem: [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img152.imageshack.us/img152/8647/70262372oe6.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: ".." bug
item.dc:creator: @I_PK_Pigeons I PK Pigeons
item.description:
@I_PK_Pigeons wrote:

[quote=“gary1988, post:21, topic:247670”]guys i know how to fix this basically, swap ur ints around, so they start with the

if(i == 7887) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.aString170 = "Camo-Flared pants"; class8.aByteArray178 = "oooo cool gear man.".getBytes(); class8.anIntArray156 = new int[5]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[5]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 10337; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 12821; // Color number here class8.anIntArray156[1] = 10349; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 12821; // Color number here class8.anIntArray156[2] = 10361; class8.anIntArray160[2] = 12821; // Color number here class8.anIntArray156[3] = 10341; class8.anIntArray160[3] = 12821; // Color number here class8.anIntArray156[4] = 82; class8.anIntArray160[4] = 12821; // Color number here class8.anInt174 = 13001; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt165 = 13002; // Male Wield Model class8.anInt200 = 13003; // Female Wield class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt181 = 2151; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 429; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1189; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = 7; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = 5; // Position in inv, increase to move up }
put them in the same format as that, and it works fine heres a screenie as proof

hope it helps you guys all u do is, make sure this part is at the very top

if(i == 7887)
{
	class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
	class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
	class8.aString170 = "Camo-Flared pants";
	class8.aByteArray178 = "oooo cool gear man.".getBytes();

then build the rest of the int under it
gary[/quote]

Lol not anywhere near the proper fix, though if it works it works, just its a bit inefficient

	case 14479:
		class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
		class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
		class8.anInt174 = 14104; //Model ID
		class8.anInt181 = 1360;
		class8.anInt190 = 443;
		class8.anInt198 = 2047;
		class8.anInt169 = -1;
		class8.anInt194 = 11;
		class8.anInt204 = 0;
		class8.anInt165 = 14105; 
		class8.anInt200 = 14105;
		class8.anInt179 = 14479;
		class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable
		class8.aString170 = "Dragon platebody";
		class8.aByteArray178 = "An ancient Platebody".getBytes();
	break;

Here, fix for all items.

Client.java search

aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = class8.aStringArray168[j3] + " @lre@" + class8.aString170;

You’ll see

                                if(class8.aStringArray168 != null && class8.aStringArray168[j3] != null)
                                {
                                    aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = class8.aStringArray168[j3] + " @lre@" + class8.aString170;
                                    if(j3 == 0)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 652;
                                    if(j3 == 1)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 567;
                                    if(j3 == 2)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 234;
                                    if(j3 == 3)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 244;
                                    if(j3 == 4)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 213;
                                    anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
                                    anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
                                    anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;
                                    anInt1133++;
                                } else

Make it look like

                               /* if(class8.aStringArray168 != null && class8.aStringArray168[j3] != null)
                                {
                                    aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = class8.aStringArray168[j3] + " @lre@" + class8.aString170;
                                    if(j3 == 0)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 652;
                                    if(j3 == 1)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 567;
                                    if(j3 == 2)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 234;
                                    if(j3 == 3)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 244;
                                    if(j3 == 4)
                                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 213;
                                    anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
                                    anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
                                    anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;
                                    anInt1133++;
                                } else*/

Then its completely fixed.

Pic

iz71wp.png769×557

the elve age:

that is a pain in the ass if you do that way…especially when you have fucking 60+ models in yours lol

Lol, I have 250+ in mine, my method got so huge it wouldn’t compile so I had to turn it into a switch statement

item.title: ".." bug
item.dc:creator: @gary1988 gary1988
item.description:
@gary1988 wrote:

guys i know how to fix this basically, swap ur ints around, so they start with the

if(i == 7887)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.aString170 = “Camo-Flared pants”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “oooo cool gear man.”.getBytes();
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[5];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[5];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 10337;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 12821; // Color number here
class8.anIntArray156[1] = 10349;
class8.anIntArray160[1] = 12821; // Color number here
class8.anIntArray156[2] = 10361;
class8.anIntArray160[2] = 12821; // Color number here
class8.anIntArray156[3] = 10341;
class8.anIntArray160[3] = 12821; // Color number here
class8.anIntArray156[4] = 82;
class8.anIntArray160[4] = 12821; // Color number here
class8.anInt174 = 13001; // Drop/Inv Model
class8.anInt165 = 13002; // Male Wield Model
class8.anInt200 = 13003; // Female Wield
class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used)
class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used)
class8.anInt181 = 2151; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller
class8.anInt190 = 429; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards
class8.anInt198 = 1189; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right
class8.anInt169 = 7; // Position in inv, increase to move right
class8.anInt194 = 5; // Position in inv, increase to move up
}
put them in the same format as that, and it works fine heres a screenie as proof

hope it helps you guys all u do is, make sure this part is at the very top
if(i == 7887)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.aString170 = “Camo-Flared pants”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “oooo cool gear man.”.getBytes();

then build the rest of the int under it
gary

Read full topic
